description: Alteration of Early Scots crud (“curd”), cognate with Early Modern English and Middle English crud, crudde (14th c.), crodde of obscure origin.

entries.meaning: (Scotland, now historical) Gruel or thin porridge.
examples: The old woman shuffled out from the back room with a handful of coal and a bowl of crowdie for the boy.

entries.meaning: A Scottish form of cottage cheese.
